L1subscriptğ¿1L_{1}-metric DP parameter Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilon for MVU/I-MVU 0.25,0.5,0.75,1,2,3,50.250.50.7512350.25,0.5,0.75,1,2,3,5

references: To address these issues, we propose a new interpolation scheme for extending the MVU mechanism to continuous-valued vector inputs. Our new scheme relaxes the unbiasedness requirement in MVU and makes it more suitable for FL use cases. Our first insight is that the categorical distribution used in MVU can be expressed in exponential family form as follows:

Training details. We train a simple 4-layer convolutional network with 46k parameters for classification. The model achieves 84%percent8484\% accuracy when trained non-privately with FL. The client optimizer is SGD with a learning rate of 0.10.10.1 and no momentum. The server implements FedAvgÂ (McMahan etÂ al., 2017) with a momentum of 0.90.90.9. We perform a grid search on the server learning rate, the clipping factor, the noise multiplier Ïƒğœ\sigma for Gaussian and SignSGD, noise scale Î¼ğœ‡\mu for Skellam, and the L1subscriptğ¿1L_{1}-metric DP Ïµitalic-Ïµ\epsilon and scale hyperparameters for I-MVU.
The hyperparameter ranges are given in TablesÂ 5, 4 and 6 in the appendix. In particular, SignSGD uses a much lower server-side learning rates since the updates (in {Â±1}plus-or-minus1\{\pm 1\}) have higher magnitude.

The problem of privacy-aware compression for distributed mean estimation (DME) has received much attention in recent years.
Prior work proposed notable mechanisms such as PrivUnitÂ (Bhowmick etÂ al., 2018; Asi etÂ al., 2022), discrete GaussianÂ (Canonne etÂ al., 2020; Kairouz etÂ al., 2021a), SkellamÂ (Agarwal etÂ al., 2021), MVUÂ (Chaudhuri etÂ al., 2022) and othersÂ (Chen etÂ al., 2020; Girgis etÂ al., 2021; Shah etÂ al., 2022; Chen etÂ al., 2022b; Lang & Shlezinger, 2022) for computing the mean of a set of vectors under communication constraint. Feldman & Talwar (2021) provides a general procedure for converting a non-compressed mechanism to a compressed one that is computationally differentially private under the assumption that the pseudo-random generator in the privacy mechanism is hard to break.

The privacy vs. accuracy curves in the paper plot the Pareto frontier across a grid of hyperparameters.
Table 1 gives the range of hyperparameter values used in FigureÂ 2. Table 2 gives the range of hyperparameters used in FigureÂ 3. Table 3 gives the range of hyperparameter values used in FigureÂ 4.
Tables 4, 5 and 6 give the range of hyperparameter values used in FigureÂ 5.
